title: How discreet hairpieces have won over the youthfully bald
description: Bald people or those experiencing hair loss can now turn to specialized establishments to get an undetectable prosthesis made of real hair attached to their head.

title: Notre-Dame's restoration: 'We are rebuilding a 21st-century cathedral'
description: In an interview, the president of the public institution in charge of restoring the Paris cathedral confirms that it will reopen partially at the end of 2024, as planned.

title: French unions say battle against pension reform 'not over'
description: The alliance of 13 labor unions and youth groups are calling for another day of mobilization on Labor Day, on May 1st.

title: India, the new demographic powerhouse
description: With 1.417 billion inhabitants, India's population now surpasses that of China and is expected to continue to grow until 2060 to reach 1.7 billion. This situation presents the country with multiple challenges.

title: US and Vietnam pledge to boost relations during Blinken's visit to Hanoi
description: The US Secretary of State is visiting to strengthen Washington's ties with Hanoi, as America seeks to counter China's increasing assertiveness in the Indo-Pacific.

title: Japanese PM unhurt after explosive device thrown at him during campaign event
description: Although no one was hurt, the scene was reminiscent of the assassination ago of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe nine months ago.

title: Five skateparks in and around Paris to show off your flip tricks
description: Dozens of skateboard, freestyle scooter, BMX and rollerblade parks are scattered around the Paris region – perfect locations to practice, or show off, your tricks.

title: In Paris after the Constitutional Council approved most of the pension reform: 'Nobody revolts after that?'
description: Several thousand demonstrators gathered in the capital on Friday, awaiting a decision that left them more disappointed than surprised.

title: Germany is bringing an end to its nuclear age
description: The last three nuclear reactors in Germany will be gradually switched off on Saturday, as Europe's largest economy has been looking to phase out nuclear power since 2002.

title: Macron enacts contested pension reform, despite still strong protests
description: The pension reform was officially signed into law by the French president on the night of Friday, April 14, after the Constitutional Council validated the core of the bill.

title: Fighting rocks Sudan's capital as regular army battles paramilitaries
description: The eruption of violence came after weeks of deepening tensions over the planned integration of the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) into the regular army.

title: French pension reform: The damages of a never-ending conflict
description: To get out of the pension dispute, Emmanuel Macron cannot simply invoke the legal nature of the Constitutional Council's decision, which on Friday approved the key elements of his controversial reform.

title: From TikTok to Instagram, the controversial triumph of short videos
description: TikTok's immense popularity has sparked fierce competition for short-form video dominance between Meta and Google on social media networks. The content's appeal is undeniable, but concerns are mounting over addiction and cognitive decline.

title: French pension reform: the bill has been officially promulgated
description: Following the French Constitutional Council approval of the core of the bill on Friday, April 14, the government promised its promulgation within forty-eight hours. According to the country's Journal Officiel, it is now done.

title: Shole Pakravan, an Iranian woman fighting the death penalty
description: Exiled to Germany with her two remaining daughters, the mother of Reyhaneh Jabbari, executed in 2014 for killing the man who tried to rape her in 2007, believes her country's young people will triumph over oppression.

title: Japan torn after Emmanuel Macron's remarks on Taiwan
description: Tokyo fears that the French position will cause dissension among its allies, while secretly welcoming the fact that the French president's words about continuing dialogue with China will help calm regional tension with Beijing.

title: Mariupol, a chronicle of martyrdom
description: But in May 2022, Russia seized control of the city in Eastern Ukraine after 80 days of carnage. In the rubble, the surviving residents who escaped the bombs and deportation helplessly watch as the occupier systematically erases the traces of its crimes.

title: Despite all controversies, Rwanda is preparing to receive migrants deported by the UK
description: The funding allocated by London to Kigali is being used to renovate and reserve hotels identified as temporary accommodation for asylum seekers.
